byline.contributor: Nikolay Khalip contributed reporting from St. Petersburg, and Maïa de la Baume from Paris.

abstract: Russia hosts International Russian Conservative Forum in St Petersburg, drawing in representatives from fringe right-wing political groups around Europe and United States; one-day conference, in which attendees denounced Western values and governments, is seen as latest attempt by Russia to make allies from all sides of the political spectrum.
lead_paragraph: Russia invited representatives of fringe right-wing political groups to a conference in St. Petersburg, where the activists inveighed against Western values and governments.

headline.main: Right-Wing Groups Find a Haven, for a Day, in Russia
headline.print_headline: Right-Wing Groups Find a Haven, for a Day, in Russia

snippet: Russia invited representatives of fringe right-wing political groups to a conference in St. Petersburg, where the activists inveighed against Western values and governments.
